adjectives.description: agley (comparative more agley, superlative most agley)

examples: But though the bear in the picture was a disguised man he appeared so naturally calm, so benignly strong, that beside him Pete […] looked comparatively shifty and agley.

adverbs.description: agley (comparative more agley, superlative most agley)

entries.meaning: (chiefly Scotland) Wrong, awry, askew, amiss, or distortedly.
examples: X tells of cavalry; of Sheridan, Hampton and Fitz Lee;
Of Early’s Valley march, that Sheridan long held agley!
